Dialogue.0: You and Rein spend a few hours hiking through the woods and exploring the rugged coastline to the north of the village.
Dialogue.1: It's cold out, but you both bundle up in thick fur jackets and press on through a drizzling rain to reach the top of a little rise.
Dialogue.2: As you stop to rest in the old wooden gazebo that sits atop the hill, Rein turns toward you with a question in her eyes.
Dialogue.3: "Hey, {name}. I don't know if I mentioned this before, but... I've been getting pretty into my paintings recently. And I think I'm going to get a show soon!"
Dialogue.4: "I just— ***there's just one problem;** I only have landscapes.
Dialogue.5: I mean, there's nothing wrong with landscapes**—I love landscapes—**but** I figured maybe it'd be best to branch out?"
Dialogue.6: "**Aaaaand also my patron said I should or the show would be a failure so..."
Dialogue.7: Is it just you or is she avoiding your eyes? **Either way, you should probably speak up before she psychs herself out of whatever she wants to ask.
Dialogue.8: "Yes. I'll do it. Your show will not be a failure."
Dialogue.9: "Your patron doesn't know what she's talking about! Your landscapes are beautiful."
Dialogue.10: "Oh, you should do a portrait of Ol 'Enry! People would love that!"
Dialogue.13: "Wait, but I didn't even ask you—"
Dialogue.14: You tell her you're up for pretty much whatever, as long as it helps out her art show.
Dialogue.15: Judging by the sudden relief on her face, you guess she must have been pretty stressed about this.
Dialogue.16: "Alright, thank you so much! I'll just paint you doing whatever you want to represent you—fishing, exploring, haggling with shopkeepers..."
Dialogue.18: You tell her you that even if you don't, you'll make time. ***Although, what could you really have scheduled at this point... visiting the docks? Drinks at the bar?
Dialogue.19: Either way, Rein seems happy as you trek down to the village, and the miserable drizzle even lets up to mirror her mood.** Nice!
Dialogue.21: "Thanks, but I really don't want to argue with her... I mean, she is my patron. Which means, you know, she gives me money to do art."
Dialogue.22: "If I anger her, she can just stop supporting me.*** I'd have to stop painting, get a day job... I—**uh, I'd rather just do a portrait"
Dialogue.23: "Ok, how about you do one of me?"
Dialogue.24: "Hmm... maybe 'Enry would be willing to let you paint him?"
Dialogue.32: "Oh, that is a good idea... people love him, don't they?"
Dialogue.33: You're not sure how much she believes what she's saying, but she's not wrong. People do love 'Enry, and you know a portrait of him will be a hit.
Dialogue.34: So why can't you shake the feeling that things didn't go the way they were supposed to?
Dialogue.35: "Alright, see you {name}! Thanks for exploring with me, even if the weather was determined to make us regret it."
